trans-unit.source: Step 1: Add the X12 SalesOrder (840) Schema and Transform to the Visual Studio Project
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Add the X12 SalesOrder (840) Schema and Transform to the Visual Studio Project

trans-unit.source: In this step, you include the X12 840 sales order schema in your project.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you include the X12 840 sales order schema in your project.

trans-unit.source: You also create a <token>transform</token> to map the elements in the X12 schema and the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> schema you created in <link xlink:href="3ff6545f-a395-48d9-80d9-c756f987bf98" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 2: Create SalesOrder Schema</link>.
trans-unit.target: You also create a <token>transform</token> to map the elements in the X12 schema and the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> schema you created in <link xlink:href="3ff6545f-a395-48d9-80d9-c756f987bf98" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 2: Create SalesOrder Schema</link>.

trans-unit.source: This is required because the EDI <token>bridge</token> configured using the <token>tpm_portal</token> sends the message to the EAI bridge, which expects the incoming messages in the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> schema.
trans-unit.target: This is required because the EDI <token>bridge</token> configured using the <token>tpm_portal</token> sends the message to the EAI bridge, which expects the incoming messages in the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> schema.

trans-unit.source: In this step, you add the X12 840 sales order schema and the <token>transform</token> to the <embeddedLabel>EAIEDITutorial</embeddedLabel> <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you add the X12 840 sales order schema and the <token>transform</token> to the <embeddedLabel>EAIEDITutorial</embeddedLabel> <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: However, you can always create a new project for just the schema and the <token>transform</token>.
trans-unit.target: However, you can always create a new project for just the schema and the <token>transform</token>.

trans-unit.source: Typically, you should create a <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service Artifacts</embeddedLabel> project for such schemas and <token>transform</token>s.
trans-unit.target: Typically, you should create a <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service Artifacts</embeddedLabel> project for such schemas and <token>transform</token>s.

trans-unit.source: For more information about this project type, see <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create a BizTalk Service Project</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about this project type, see <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create a BizTalk Service Project</link>.

trans-unit.source: To include the X12 840 schema in the Visual Studio project
trans-unit.target: To include the X12 840 schema in the Visual Studio project

trans-unit.source: Download the EDI X12 schemas from <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=235057</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=235057</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Download the EDI X12 schemas from <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=235057</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=235057</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The schema is available as part of the <embeddedLabel>MicrosoftEdiXSDTemplates.zip</embeddedLabel> package.
trans-unit.target: The schema is available as part of the <embeddedLabel>MicrosoftEdiXSDTemplates.zip</embeddedLabel> package.

trans-unit.source: Right click the <embeddedLabel>EAIEDITutorial</embeddedLabel> project in <token>vs_current_short</token>, point to <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>, and then click <embeddedLabel>Existing Item</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right click the <embeddedLabel>EAIEDITutorial</embeddedLabel> project in <token>vs_current_short</token>, point to <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>, and then click <embeddedLabel>Existing Item</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the location where you downloaded and extracted the schemas, select the X12 840 schema (X12_00401_840.xsd), and add it to the project.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the location where you downloaded and extracted the schemas, select the X12 840 schema (X12_00401_840.xsd), and add it to the project.

trans-unit.source: Create a <token>transform</token> between the X12 840 schema and the SalesOrder schema.
trans-unit.target: Create a <token>transform</token> between the X12 840 schema and the SalesOrder schema.

trans-unit.source: You must create a <token>transform</token> to extract the values you want from the X12 message and reflect them in the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> message.
trans-unit.target: You must create a <token>transform</token> to extract the values you want from the X12 message and reflect them in the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> message.

trans-unit.source: Specify the name of the map as <embeddedLabel>EDI840ToSalesOrder.trfm</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Specify the name of the map as <embeddedLabel>EDI840ToSalesOrder.trfm</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <link xlink:href="e102686a-b1c5-467d-8f22-8fadec19189f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Creating a Transform Project (EDI Project)</link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <link xlink:href="e102686a-b1c5-467d-8f22-8fadec19189f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Creating a Transform Project (EDI Project)</link>.

trans-unit.source: To include a transform
trans-unit.target: To include a transform

trans-unit.source: In <token>vs_current_short</token>, right-click the <embeddedLabel>EAIEDITutorial</embeddedLabel> project, point to <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>, and then click <embeddedLabel>New Item</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <token>vs_current_short</token>, right-click the <embeddedLabel>EAIEDITutorial</embeddedLabel> project, point to <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>, and then click <embeddedLabel>New Item</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use an already created map, you can use the <embeddedLabel>EDI840ToSalesOrder.trfm</embeddedLabel> map.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use an already created map, you can use the <embeddedLabel>EDI840ToSalesOrder.trfm</embeddedLabel> map.

trans-unit.source: This map is available as part of the sample available from the <externalLink><linkText>MSDN Code Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316856</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This map is available as part of the sample available from the <externalLink><linkText>MSDN Code Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316856</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: In the <userInput>Add New Item</userInput> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Map</embeddedLabel>, specify the map name as <userInput>EDI840ToSalesOrder.trfm</userInput>, and then click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <userInput>Add New Item</userInput> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Map</embeddedLabel>, specify the map name as <userInput>EDI840ToSalesOrder.trfm</userInput>, and then click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, double-click the <embeddedLabel>EDI840ToSalesOrder.trfm</embeddedLabel> file to open the map.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, double-click the <embeddedLabel>EDI840ToSalesOrder.trfm</embeddedLabel> file to open the map.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>transform</token> window, select the source schema to <embeddedLabel>X12_00401_840.xsd</embeddedLabel> and the destination schema to <embeddedLabel>ECommerceSalesOrder.xsd</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>transform</token> window, select the source schema to <embeddedLabel>X12_00401_840.xsd</embeddedLabel> and the destination schema to <embeddedLabel>ECommerceSalesOrder.xsd</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Directly map the following nodes in the source and destination schemas:
trans-unit.target: Directly map the following nodes in the source and destination schemas:

trans-unit.source: Source Schema
trans-unit.target: Source Schema

trans-unit.source: Destination Schema
trans-unit.target: Destination Schema

trans-unit.source: N1Loop1/N2/N201
trans-unit.target: N1Loop1/N2/N201

trans-unit.source: CompanyCode
trans-unit.target: CompanyCode

trans-unit.source: PO1Loop1/PO1/PO107
trans-unit.target: PO1Loop1/PO1/PO107

trans-unit.source: PartID
trans-unit.target: PartID

trans-unit.source: PO1Loop1/PO1/PO102
trans-unit.target: PO1Loop1/PO1/PO102

trans-unit.source: Quantity
trans-unit.target: Quantity

trans-unit.source: PO1Loop1/PO1/PO104
trans-unit.target: PO1Loop1/PO1/PO104

trans-unit.source: AskPrice
trans-unit.target: AskPrice

trans-unit.source: N1Loop1/N3/N301
trans-unit.target: N1Loop1/N3/N301

trans-unit.source: Address/Line1
trans-unit.target: Address/Line1

trans-unit.source: N1Loop1/N3/N302
trans-unit.target: N1Loop1/N3/N302

trans-unit.source: Address/Line2
trans-unit.target: Address/Line2

trans-unit.source: N1Loop1/N4/N401
trans-unit.target: N1Loop1/N4/N401

trans-unit.source: Address/City
trans-unit.target: Address/City

trans-unit.source: N1Loop1/N3/N402
trans-unit.target: N1Loop1/N3/N402

trans-unit.source: Address/State
trans-unit.target: Address/State

trans-unit.source: N1Loop1/N4/N404
trans-unit.target: N1Loop1/N4/N404

trans-unit.source: Address/Country
trans-unit.target: Address/Country

trans-unit.source: N1Loop1/N4/N403
trans-unit.target: N1Loop1/N4/N403

trans-unit.source: Address/Zipcode
trans-unit.target: Address/Zipcode

trans-unit.source: PER/PER02
trans-unit.target: PER/PER02

trans-unit.source: Contact/Firstname
trans-unit.target: Contact/Firstname

trans-unit.source: PER/PER04
trans-unit.target: PER/PER04

trans-unit.source: Contact/Lastname
trans-unit.target: Contact/Lastname

trans-unit.source: Map the elements from the source schema (X12_00401_840) to the <embeddedLabel>RequestShipmentDate</embeddedLabel> element.
trans-unit.target: Map the elements from the source schema (X12_00401_840) to the <embeddedLabel>RequestShipmentDate</embeddedLabel> element.

trans-unit.source: The element in the source message that has the requested shipment date is <embeddedLabel>BQT05</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The element in the source message that has the requested shipment date is <embeddedLabel>BQT05</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The value in that element is in the format YYYYMMDD.
trans-unit.target: The value in that element is in the format YYYYMMDD.

trans-unit.source: The value that must be entered in <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> schema must be of the form YYYY-MM-DD.
trans-unit.target: The value that must be entered in <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> schema must be of the form YYYY-MM-DD.

trans-unit.source: So, to achieve that, you must map the <embeddedLabel>BQT05</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>RequestShipmentDate</embeddedLabel> elements as shown in the screenshot below:
trans-unit.target: So, to achieve that, you must map the <embeddedLabel>BQT05</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>RequestShipmentDate</embeddedLabel> elements as shown in the screenshot below:

trans-unit.source: To achieve this mapping, this is what you must do:
trans-unit.target: To achieve this mapping, this is what you must do:

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop a <embeddedLabel>String Extract</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> on the mapper surface and connect it to the BTS05 element from the source schema.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop a <embeddedLabel>String Extract</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> on the mapper surface and connect it to the BTS05 element from the source schema.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the <embeddedLabel>String Extract</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> and set the <embeddedLabel>Start Index</embeddedLabel> property to <userInput>1</userInput> and the <embeddedLabel>End Index</embeddedLabel> property to <userInput>4</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the <embeddedLabel>String Extract</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> and set the <embeddedLabel>Start Index</embeddedLabel> property to <userInput>1</userInput> and the <embeddedLabel>End Index</embeddedLabel> property to <userInput>4</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop a <embeddedLabel>String Extract</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> on the mapper surface and connect it to the BTS05 element from the source schema.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop a <embeddedLabel>String Extract</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> on the mapper surface and connect it to the BTS05 element from the source schema.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the <embeddedLabel>String Extract</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> and set the <embeddedLabel>Start Index</embeddedLabel> property to <userInput>5</userInput> and the <embeddedLabel>End Index</embeddedLabel> property to <userInput>6</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the <embeddedLabel>String Extract</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> and set the <embeddedLabel>Start Index</embeddedLabel> property to <userInput>5</userInput> and the <embeddedLabel>End Index</embeddedLabel> property to <userInput>6</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop a <embeddedLabel>String Extract</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> on the mapper surface and connect it to the BTS05 element from the source schema.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop a <embeddedLabel>String Extract</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> on the mapper surface and connect it to the BTS05 element from the source schema.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the <embeddedLabel>String Extract</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> and set the <embeddedLabel>Start Index</embeddedLabel> property to <userInput>7</userInput> and the <embeddedLabel>End Index</embeddedLabel> property to <userInput>8</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the <embeddedLabel>String Extract</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> and set the <embeddedLabel>Start Index</embeddedLabel> property to <userInput>7</userInput> and the <embeddedLabel>End Index</embeddedLabel> property to <userInput>8</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: With this, you have now extracted the values for YYYY, MM, and DD.
trans-unit.target: With this, you have now extracted the values for YYYY, MM, and DD.

trans-unit.source: You must now use the <embeddedLabel>String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> to join the extracted values using a hyphen (-).
trans-unit.target: You must now use the <embeddedLabel>String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> to join the extracted values using a hyphen (-).

trans-unit.source: This is how the configuration for the <embeddedLabel>String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> looks like.
trans-unit.target: This is how the configuration for the <embeddedLabel>String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> looks like.

trans-unit.source: In this screenshot, <embeddedLabel>Input_0</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Input_2</embeddedLabel>, and <embeddedLabel>Input_4</embeddedLabel> are from the <embeddedLabel>String Extract</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token>s that are connected to the <embeddedLabel>String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token>.
trans-unit.target: In this screenshot, <embeddedLabel>Input_0</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Input_2</embeddedLabel>, and <embeddedLabel>Input_4</embeddedLabel> are from the <embeddedLabel>String Extract</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token>s that are connected to the <embeddedLabel>String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token>.

trans-unit.source: Values for <embeddedLabel>Input_1</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Input_3</embeddedLabel> are set as hyphens (-).
trans-unit.target: Values for <embeddedLabel>Input_1</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Input_3</embeddedLabel> are set as hyphens (-).

trans-unit.source: After this <token>mapop</token>, the value that will be transferred to the <embeddedLabel>RequestShipmentDate</embeddedLabel> element will be in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
trans-unit.target: After this <token>mapop</token>, the value that will be transferred to the <embeddedLabel>RequestShipmentDate</embeddedLabel> element will be in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

trans-unit.source: You must now connect the <embeddedLabel>String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> to the <embeddedLabel>RequestShipmentDate</embeddedLabel> element in the destination schema.
trans-unit.target: You must now connect the <embeddedLabel>String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> to the <embeddedLabel>RequestShipmentDate</embeddedLabel> element in the destination schema.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the tasks in the previous step to map the <embeddedLabel>BQT03</embeddedLabel> element in the source schema to the <embeddedLabel>DateNow</embeddedLabel> element in the destination schema.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the tasks in the previous step to map the <embeddedLabel>BQT03</embeddedLabel> element in the source schema to the <embeddedLabel>DateNow</embeddedLabel> element in the destination schema.

trans-unit.source: The mapped elements must look like the following:
trans-unit.target: The mapped elements must look like the following:

trans-unit.source: To populate a value in the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> element, map the N201 element in the source schema with the Comments element in the destination schema using the <embeddedLabel>String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token>.
trans-unit.target: To populate a value in the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> element, map the N201 element in the source schema with the Comments element in the destination schema using the <embeddedLabel>String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token>.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop a <embeddedLabel>String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> on the mapper surface.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop a <embeddedLabel>String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> on the mapper surface.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the <token>mapop</token> to open the <embeddedLabel>Configure String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> dialog box and set the Input_0 property to “<userInput>Order from partner </userInput>“.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the <token>mapop</token> to open the <embeddedLabel>Configure String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> dialog box and set the Input_0 property to “<userInput>Order from partner </userInput>“.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Connect the <embeddedLabel>N201</embeddedLabel> element in the source schema to the <embeddedLabel>String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> and then join the <embeddedLabel>mapop</embeddedLabel> to the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> element in the destination schema.
trans-unit.target: Connect the <embeddedLabel>N201</embeddedLabel> element in the source schema to the <embeddedLabel>String Concatenate</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> and then join the <embeddedLabel>mapop</embeddedLabel> to the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> element in the destination schema.

trans-unit.source: The configuration for the <token>mapop</token> must resemble the following:
trans-unit.target: The configuration for the <token>mapop</token> must resemble the following:

trans-unit.source: With this configuration, if the value in the <embeddedLabel>N201</embeddedLabel> element in the source schema is <legacyItalic>XYZ</legacyItalic>, for example, the value in the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> element in the destination schema will be set to <legacyItalic>Order from Partner XYZ</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: With this configuration, if the value in the <embeddedLabel>N201</embeddedLabel> element in the source schema is <legacyItalic>XYZ</legacyItalic>, for example, the value in the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> element in the destination schema will be set to <legacyItalic>Order from Partner XYZ</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the map.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the map.
